criteria: Understanding of Terminating and Repeating Decimals
descriptions: No attempt to convert rational numbers to decimals or perform multiplication/division.
Demonstrates minimal understanding; calculations are incorrect with no clear strategy.
Conversion to decimals attempted but with significant errors. Multiplication/division shows limited understanding of rules.
Converts rational numbers to decimals with some errors. Multiplication/division performed with occasional mistakes.
Accurately converts rational numbers to decimals using long division. Multiplies and divides rational numbers with minor errors.

Consistently and accurately converts rational numbers to decimals and performs multiplication/division, showing a strong understanding of the relationship between rational numbers and their decimal representations.
No understanding of terminating or repeating decimals is shown.
Unable to identify terminating or repeating decimals.
Identifies some terminating decimals, but unable to differentiate between repeating and non-repeating decimals.
Can differentiate between terminating and repeating decimals, but explanation lacks clarity.
Clearly explains the difference between terminating and repeating decimals with relevant examples.
Provides a comprehensive explanation of terminating and repeating decimals, including why some rational numbers result in each type, demonstrating deep understanding.
Does not apply any relevant properties or rules of multiplication/division of rational numbers.
Attempts to apply properties but does so incorrectly or inconsistently.
Applies some properties correctly in simple problems but struggles with more complex scenarios.
Generally applies properties and rules correctly, but may overlook nuances in certain situations.
Consistently applies properties and rules of multiplication/division of rational numbers, with clear justifications.
Masterfully applies properties and rules, providing insightful justifications and using them to solve complex problems efficiently.
